list_definition.definition: a circular piece of ground where several roads meet, and round which traffic must travel; traffic circle American

list_definition.mean_english: vòng ngựa gỗ cho trẻ em
list_definition.definition: a revolving machine on which one can ride for pleasure; a merry-go-round.

list_ex_of_english: Thus, repress the instantaneous motions of merriment may be seen as a roundabout and obscure way of saying stop laughing.
At times, roundabouts or other forms of traffic control might be more appropriate than traffic lights.
I appreciate that the amendment is a roundabout way of meeting our argument.
The ten essays together manage to achieve most of these objectives, albeit sometimes in a roundabout and discursive way.
This is a matter of swings and roundabouts.
What he loses on the swings he may gain on the roundabout.
They have wanted war, they have been waging it upon us for three years, but in a clandestine, hypocritical, roundabout manner.
